column3: Should bump the version number too (eg, qt-win32-4.7.4-gitian.zip => qt-win32-4.7.4-gitian-r1.zip).\n

Are you sure?

`-no-style-XXX` didn't work here, even causes an option parse error in configure, though it is mentioned in the online documentation: http://doc.qt.nokia.com/4.7-snapshot/configure-options.html . `no-style-XXX` options are no longer mentioned in the configure documentation (configure --help) and the configure bash script that is used on unix-like systems.

`-no-feature-style-XXX

Can for sure be a difference between configure and configure.exe and if it works everything is fine :).\nBut at least the -no-opengl seems correct, when you use configure --help you should be able to verify that.\n
Yep, I've verified, -no-opengl seems to be interchangable with -opengl no. \n
Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/e598b5b5c2343bcb08bcf804249bdb67180baa41 for binaries and test log.\n
ACK.  Should we pull this for 0.7rc2 ?\n
The pull makes sense and I also used the switches in my own builds and they work (and do not harm bitcoin-qt.exe for me), so I'll vote ACK for 0.7rc2.\n
I think it's safe to pull this for rc2. Though it means we all have to rebuild qt for the next release.\n

After `-no-javascript-jit` there is an unneeded space, which you could remove. And btw. now I know where the Qt static build is coming from ^^ `-static`. I have 2 additional switches in my local configure line, which are `-no-dsp -no-vcproj`. As far as I remember they are only needed for MSVC support.

Edit: And shouldn't it read `-no-opengl` instead of `-opengl no`?

Edit 2: Sorry for that ma
